result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to pay costs of $243 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court-appointed attorney fees

--to complete a Certified Batterers Intervention Program

Arresting Agency:  Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J. Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 8:41am. 
Defendant Daniel J. Clark in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Clark guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 1.

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Clark on Probation for one year, with conditions:

--to complete a Certified Batterers Intervention Program
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court-appointed attorney fees

The posted $500 Cash Bond is to be applied toward payment of costs.
Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess 9:03am.
The Court appoints Attorney Luchsinger//repayment order of $30 a month starting on 05-27-15

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

Case called at 10:08 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Daniel J. Clark in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court copntinues a $500 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Jeffrey Purtell
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-prints & photos if not already taken
Recess: 10:11 am
